intro: Argostemma khasianum, commonly known as the Khasi argostemma, is a herbaceous plant native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants. The plant features opposite, elliptic leaves that are often pubescent, and it produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in cymes. It is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest undergrowth. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
